column4: hey, did anything major come through in the last round of upgrades?
i just upgraded my hardy box, and then it died (black screen) a couple hours later
and it won't boot any more (dies on login)
would anyone knkow where i should look to fix it?
bad updates? bad x.org config? (there wern't any x updates i don't remember)
there doesn't seem to be anything yet on google about this
has this happened to anyone else here?
how would i go about fixing it? (major part)
moniter goes blank, complains that it has no input
I was having some serious problems in that vein, which arose from my efforts to fix the problems caused by the kernel update about 6 days ago.
hmmm, k. i tried and older kernel and it had the same issue

I eventually slipped and accidentally did an aptitude full-upgrade after adding the hardy-proposed repository to my source.list.  It upgraded a ton of things, and now everything except the original wireless problem is back to normal.  Only I'm on hardy-proposed now, of course.

I'm not sure what the deal is with hardy-proposed, but if it's anything like a dist-upgrade, then it's going to be hard/impossible to go backwards, so I'm either stuck on hardy-proposed or I reinstall from scratrch.
update just updates apt's record of packages, shoudn't actually install anything.
it was through the little update manager thing
Ah, okay, that was equivalent to a full-upgrade.
